name: Zombie Training Simulator
description: Are you ready for the zombie apocalypse? We've done the research and want to make sure you're prepared. When the news reports the zombies are here and your friend gives you a call, "They're here. I need you," how will you respond? That's right, you'll say "I'll be right over. We've got this thanks to ZTS!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7+ Processor: Intel Core i5 4590 equivalent or greater Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 970/AMD Radeon R9 290 equivalent or greater DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 800 MB available space

reviews.review_text: This is the first time I ever wrote a review for any game on Steam (even with 700+ in my library).  I've so far had the vive for a week and have around 70 games/demoes so far.  This is by far one of my top 5 games for VR. If you want a great shooter, this is the one to get - the feel of the shooting rivals H3VR, even though it is cartoon zombies - the graphics, especially when it comes to the iron sights is crystal clear which makes it a lot more realistic to aim properly than in most other VR shooters I've tried so far. I've been in the military for over 20 years now, so I have some experience firing guns, and something about the mechanics in this game makes it feel right.  Do NOT let the cartoony style fool you - this is a must buy for your Vive - it is worth every penny!  Edit: If I could ask for one single addition it would be to allow for manual reload of weapons using your offhand vive controller the same way it is done in H3VR. That would make it all but perfect.

Zombie Cutouts... Yes Just a handfull of guns...Yes Just a handfull of levels...Yes So I start by tossing out the stereo, place the propane tanks on the table and pick em off, or mow em down either way it's fun as all hell. I just wish I had a grill behind the table to cook up those unthrown steaks. I've played this longer than a couple minutes and I'll tell ya now this is fun! Looking forward to new modes and a bigger arsenal. OMG A MINIGUN WOULD BE FLIPPIN AWESOME! Except the reload... that would probably suck.
This came in a package when I purchased my Vive, but I would gladly have paid <=$10 for this one.
I like the challenges section of this game and the leaderboards. This is a pretty solid game.
A great experience type game. Very polished. Probably good for a few hours of entertainment but then it becomes a grind to earn all the guns. I wish there was more depth to the game.
Though the min gpu is a r9 290, this game runs perfectly on a amd hd 7950 until i get my gpu upgraded! Totally worth it!

This is pretty cool, and has some neat ideas and mechanics, but I'm glad I got it with the content bundle.  If you like wave shooters, this is a polished one with some nice crowd-control-based gameplay, lots of guns to choose from, and some neat minigames and such. If you like zombie games, this is a kid-friendly one with a 'hardcore/night mode' that actually manages to be somewhat more tense as well.  It's a super well-rounded, well-executed game, but the core gunplay isn't all that interesting. It's mostly aiming at a bunch of zombie heads, most of which are at the exact same height, and right next to each other. As I said, the real mechanics are in the crowd control and resource management mechanics.  It's a good game, and it held my interest for a good while, but I'm not sure I'd have payed $20 for it. Still, glad to have it.
I didn't think this game would be fun, but it's definitely lots of fun! Great execution (no pun intended) on the developer's part!
Amazingly awesome. Super addicting.
Fantastic fun. Just wait til you get the automatic rifles...

I got this game with the Vive, and it looked like some ♥♥♥♥♥♥ try hard zombie wave shooter.  Boy I was wrong. This is fun! Even though it's cardboard zombies, they're so satisfying to shoot! Most definitly a game to pick up. 19,99 euroes might seem like much, but this is well polished, and a great thing to show other people. If you're not a fan of wave shooters, don't buy this. If you are however, this is probably one of the most well done ones.  I know I'll come back to this every now and then.  Co-op would be extra fun though.

thiz game iz good, plizzz come inside, but you do not needz zeapons, the zombiez do not wanna hurt you, if you do not bringz zeapons zombiez not attack, I promiz, zombiez hate deliciouz brainz. XXOO: Human

Wow.  I have around a 30 minute tolerance in VR. (HTC Vive) normally due to boredom.  This freckin game knocks it out of the ball park. It's a game I can play all afternoon.  Best money spent so far on a vive game. It's mind blowing. I hope the devs keep updating.  10 out of 10

I got this game with my vive.  Honestly i didnt exspect much, i thought it looked dumb before i installed it wand was mostly going to write it off. I am glad i did not do that.  The graphics are simple but work so so well. this is a stationary wave shooter, your enemies are cardboard cutout zombies, and dispite how aweful that sounds, its very addicting. there are multiple maps which change up stratagies, and a healthy selection of loadouts to unlock. you have variosu tools in each map that respawn with each wave, wave which can cotain hundreds of on screen enemies at once (im fairly sure i obviosuly have not counted) The sound assets are solid, and honestly for as simple as it is i have had loads and laods of fun, this is a great title to demo the vive on.  Now at 20 bucks i know alot of people may not get their money worth, i certianlly cannot say since mine was a package deal, but i can tell you ive had a good bit of fun, and if its on sale, deff worth a try.

i wish there was a REALLY recomend button. There is no freaking way to describe how great this game is. The idea is amazing, but, unlike most, you actualy made an amazing game to go wish the idea. And just when i thought this game couldn't get any better... I UNlOCKED FLIPPIN' DUEL AK'S!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Every time i play, i play for like 2hrs because i just don't wanna come out.Incredible. Just incredible.

Blummin awesome! A great little VR shooter with heaps of tactical play, pepper the area with steak and grenade crowds of zombies to get up that leaderboard! Unlocking the guns can feel like a grind, but when a new one becomes available, it feels like Christmas.

Outrageously fun, best wave-based shooter in the Vive right now. Blowing up a giant group of zombies by shooting a propane tank in mid-air is so satisfying. Gun upgrade system keeps things interesting, and high skill ceiling in the skill challenges means tons of replay value. Very polished experience, performs well, clever menu system. Priced perfectly, this one's a must-have.

Was pleasantly surprised by this, quite well polished and lots of replay value one of my favourite current VR titles. Great party game for playing with friends.   Would be nice to have some more varied weapons zombie types. Biggest problem is FPS drops from explosions especially when playing at night (980Ti @ 3770k @ 4.6Ghz, it's not my system causing the issue).

This game is very good. I like the cutout, cartoon style graphics. The developers nailed the Vive controller to pistol handling simulation. The developers did the in game feeling of holding a real weapon when you are really holding a Vive controller. My favorite in game weapon is the Glock as it is the lightest weapon in the game's arsenal and closest to the controller size and weight. The grip angle is right and the you can sight down the weapon as in real life and you can even do position Sul or other ready positions. There are no reload mechanics as reloading is automatic.  The game also has a high replay value as the game consist of quick challenges that last from a little over a second each to survival modes that may last 5 to 10 minutes each.

Don't let the cardboard cutouts fool you, this is a very good game. I especially like the strategy involved with the resources on the table. It'd be nice to be able to earn more between waves. More guns would be nice too (a lot of the automatic weapons feel a little too similar).
Great game! Makes a lot of fun and is easily the least scary Zombie game out there!
A rock solid arcade shooter. Now i feel well prepared for the next zombie apocalypse
could be a little bit lower in price, but it's still a lot of fun.  And i love the cartoon-style on this one
Best arcade shooter out for vr

Oculus / Hydra user here. It works good with Oculus and a hydra setup. Game is very fun alot better then it looks. I will be spending alot more time in this game. Would love to see Co-op in this game some day.

I got this game bundled with the HTC Vive. It's fun I guess, although repetitive. I do enjoy shooting the guns, and the style of the game makes it pretty PG safe. But it gets a little dull due to the repetitiveness. I wish it was easier to unlock the guns to try out all the armory, but I got bored after just 2-3 new guns unlocking. It's not bad, just wish they could have made it a little more exciting.

While I got it for free with my vive my review assumes a >$10 price.  The guns are fairly bland and survival mode basically involves flailing madly in order to throw meat and grenades at absurdly massive hordes. Making your gun somewhat of an afterthought.  Scoreboards and challenge mode do add a bit of flavour but ultimately this isn't worth the price. Only VR game i've been disappointed by so far.

The physics and polish in this game are great; however I really think that it needs more of a 'pure' survival type mode that has either purely guns or just guns and maybe some gernades. Having to worry about meat to attract zombies all the time is pretty annoying and takes much of the fun away for me. The shooting just feels great though and the accuracy is spot on.

Zombie Training Simulator was one of the first FPS games that I purchased and it is still one of my favorites. The controls are very simple to master for even the newest of VR users. It's fun to unload on the hordes of paper zombies as they fill the streets after your juicy brain.   Offering more levels and a two player mode would add value to an already excellent game.
No need to think, just enjoy the possibilities
Many hours of fun, and many more left to have. I keep coming back to this one and glad that I spent money on it!

Came with the vive. Thought it was gonna suck what with it being a zombie game and a shooter and not much to it. But after a bunch of beers and other substances, we cracked it open yesterday and it was surprisingly fun. I'm not sure if its worth it at that price point, but it seems to have a bit of content and unlocking the weapons after becoming familiar with the one you have is a good reason to keep mowing zombie cutouts down. Could always use a co op mode, but either way, I see myself putting in more time on this one.

I forgot to check the box when first writing the review, but I did receive this game for free with my Vive. Would've paid for it though.  This game is excellent for VR. A Wave Shooter game with various weapon types and modifiers (grenades, propane tanks, steaks to attract zombies, etc.) that also has 'skill tests' and free-form play. I would highly recommend this game to anyone that can play it. I've had zero issues with performance (6700K @4.7 ghz + GTX 980).  PROs: - wide variety of guns - increasing difficulty with different 'maps' and waves - creativity with types of zombies and the effects they have - there's always a katana strapped to your back for last ditch efforts (that's saved me a few times) - the music is fun to listen to (I love 'Strummin' ') and I kinda dance while holding dual pistols - there's a 'hardcore' mode where you play at night. Instead of being able to see all the zombies, you have to shine your flashlight (attached to each weapon) to see them, so always check behind you.  CONs: - the sound is too loud by default, so turn it down - some of the weapons take a long time to unlock (end game guns are 50,000 kills, I'm at 14,000 kills after a couple hours, but I haven't found a way to increase my kill rate) - would love even higher difficulty in terms of number of zombies rather than being in the dark
Quite entertaining wave shooter - the amount of unlockable content (new maps/weapons) always brings me back.  By the way a very good game to demonstrate VR.
